div.p: Represents a section containing entries in a composition.

description.value: Represents a section containing entries in a composition.

definition.value: Represents a section containing entries in a composition.

short.value: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.

definition.value: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.

short.value: The main type identifier for a lab, procedure, condition, etc., usually drawn from a controlled vocabulary.

definition.value: The main type identifier for a lab, procedure, condition, etc., usually drawn from a controlled vocabulary.

short.value: The actor who created the item and it responsible for the content (regardless of the information source or who recorded it). If only the author is given, it is assumed the author is the information source and the recorder.

definition.value: The actor who created the item and it responsible for the content (regardless of the information source or who recorded it). If only the author is given, it is assumed the author is the information source and the recorder.

short.value: The person or entity that the information in this resource relates to, if different than the person of record. The subject of information can be a reference or a code, the latter when the subject is described generically, for example, in terms of a relationship to the subject of record (e.g., wife).

definition.value: The person or entity that the information in this resource relates to, if different than the person of record. The subject of information can be a reference or a code, the latter when the subject is described generically, for example, in terms of a relationship to the subject of record (e.g., wife).

short.value: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

definition.value: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

short.value: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

definition.value: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

short.value: Specifies the sorting criterion applied to the items in a list.

definition.value: Specifies the sorting criterion applied to the items in a list.

short.value: Parent class for any item in clinical or administrative health-related system. A DomainResource can belong to a single person's health record, or represent an entity that surfaces in multiple records, such as organizations, providers, payments, decision support artifacts, etc.

definition.value:
Parent class for any item in clinical or administrative health-related system. A DomainResource can belong to a single person's health record, or represent an entity that surfaces in multiple records, such as organizations, providers, payments, decision support artifacts, etc.
Note to FHIR implementers: SHR includes Status and Identifier fields on DomainResource because these two attributes occur in almost every FHIR resource. The most significant exception are 3 or 4 resources that use an 'active' flag instead of coded status value. There is no apparent pattern to this inconsistency. FHIR resources that use a coded status have active and inactive as status values. In the spirit of providing a consistent object-oriented logical model for FHIR, SHR uses status across all domain resources.

short.value: Why the section is empty.

definition.value: Why the section is empty.

short.value: Represents a section containing entries in a composition.

definition.value: Represents a section containing entries in a composition.
Represents a section containing entries in a composition.

definition.value: Specifies the sorting criterion applied to the items in a list.

short.value: Parent class for any item in clinical or administrative health-related system. A DomainResource can belong to a single person's health record, or represent an entity that surfaces in multiple records, such as organizations, providers, payments, decision support artifacts, etc.

definition.value:
Parent class for any item in clinical or administrative health-related system. A DomainResource can belong to a single person's health record, or represent an entity that surfaces in multiple records, such as organizations, providers, payments, decision support artifacts, etc.
Note to FHIR implementers: SHR includes Status and Identifier fields on DomainResource because these two attributes occur in almost every FHIR resource. The most significant exception are 3 or 4 resources that use an 'active' flag instead of coded status value. There is no apparent pattern to this inconsistency. FHIR resources that use a coded status have active and inactive as status values. In the spirit of providing a consistent object-oriented logical model for FHIR, SHR uses status across all domain resources.
